Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394694) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394694)
